title.text: Quotations, Relevance and Time Depth: Medieval Arabic Literature in Grids and Networks

abstract.text: This contribution deals with the use of quotations (i.e., repeated n-grams) in the works of medieval Arabic literature. The analysis is based on a
historical corpus of Arabic. Based on

from work to work, a network is constructed and used for interpretation of various aspects of Arabic literature. Two short case studies are presented, concentrating on the centrality and relevance of individual works,
the analysis of a time depth and
resulting impact of a given work in various periods.
